action.action-desc: Ms. Williams of Georgia (for herself, Mr. Lynch, Ms. Ocasio-Cortez, Ms. Dean, Mr. García of Illinois, Ms. Tlaib, Ms. Adams, and Mr. Green of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to expand the Offices of Minority and Women Inclusion to encompass LGBTQ+ inclusion, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Promoting Responsive Inclusion and Diverse Engagement Act of 2022 or the PRIDE Act of 2022.

section.header: Expanding the Offices of Minority and Women Inclusion to encompass LGBTQ+ inclusion

subsection.text: Section 342 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5452) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the heading, by striking AND WOMEN and inserting , WOMEN, AND LGBTQ+;
by striking Office of Minority and Women Inclusion each place such term appears in heading or text and inserting Office of Minority, Women, and LGBTQ+ Inclusion;
by striking and women-owned each place such term appears and inserting , women-owned, and LGBTQ+-owned;
in subsection (b)(2)(A), by striking and gender and inserting gender, gender identity, and sexual orientation;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting LGBTQ+, after women,;
in paragraph (2), by striking and minorities and inserting , minorities, and LGBTQ+ individuals; and
in paragraph (3)(A), by striking and women and inserting , women, and LGBTQ+ individuals;
in paragraph (3), by striking and women and inserting , women, and LGBTQ+; and
in paragraph (4), by striking and women and inserting , women, and LGBTQ+ individuals;

paragraph.text: in subsection (f), by striking and women each place such term appears and inserting , women, and LGBTQ+ individuals; and
in subsection (g), by adding at the end the following:
The term LGBTQ+ means lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and other identities that experience discrimination related to their sexual orientation or gender identity.
The term LGBTQ+-owned business means a business—

subparagraph.text: more than 50 percent of the ownership or control of which is held by 1 or more LGBTQ+ individuals; and
more than 50 percent of the net profit or loss of which accrues to 1 or more LGBTQ+ individuals.

paragraph.header: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
paragraph.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5301 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the table of contents in section 1(b), in the item relating to section 342, by striking AND WOMEN and inserting , WOMEN, AND LGBTQ+; and
in section 1016(c)(9), by striking Office of Minority and Women Inclusion and inserting Office of Minority, Women, and LGBTQ+ Inclusion.

paragraph.header: Housing and Community Development Act of 1992
paragraph.text: Section 1319A of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1992 (12 U.S.C. 4520) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking Office of Minority and Women Inclusion each place such term appears in heading or text and inserting Office of Minority, Women, and LGBTQ+ Inclusion;
in subsection (b), by striking and women, and minority- and women-owned and inserting , women, and LGBTQ+ individuals, and minority-, women-, and LGBTQ+-owned;

in subsection (e), by striking and women and businesses owned by minorities and women and inserting , women, and LGBTQ+ individuals and businesses owned by minorities, women, and LGBTQ+ individuals; and

clause.text: in paragraph (2), by striking and people of color and inserting , people of color, and LGBTQ+ individuals; and
in paragraph (3), by striking and women to place talented young minorities and women and inserting , women, and LGBTQ+ individuals to place talented young minorities, women, and LGBTQ+ individuals.
